timeline.bodyText:
Maybe this is just a different (rather than better) way of tackling t his, but in my head there is no default security module (Rather than the default containing data), thus:

--security-module is an optional field, if not set, then we fallback to the KeyPair
if the --security-module doesn't reference an available securitymodule, we exit out with a failure.
timeline.author: rain-on

replies.bodyText: Having said that - should the user be allowed to write "--security-module=localfile"? (I Honestly don't know)
replies.author: rain-on

replies.bodyText: Its optional field. If user specifies it on cli (or config file) with value other than localhost, we attempt to load SecurityModule via plugin. If plugin loading fails, we exit.
replies.author: usmansaleem

replies.bodyText: It allows us to keep the usage of SecurityModule constant.
